concise_definition: v. 投掷, 丢弃, 颠簸; n. 投掷, 丢弃, 随机选择

definitions.explanation_en: To throw something lightly or casually, often with a quick motion of the arm.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用轻快、随意的动作将某物抛出，通常伴随手臂的快速动作。
definitions.example_en: He tossed the ball to his teammate during the game.
definitions.example_cn: 他在比赛中把球扔给了队友。

definitions.explanation_en: To discard or get rid of something carelessly or without concern.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指随意或毫不在意地丢弃某物。
definitions.example_en: She tossed the old magazines into the recycling bin.
definitions.example_cn: 她把旧杂志随手扔进了回收箱。

definitions.explanation_en: To move or be moved roughly, especially due to waves or turbulence (often used for ships or aircraft).
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因波浪或颠簸而剧烈晃动，常用于描述船只或飞机的颠簸状态。
definitions.example_en: The small boat was tossed about by the stormy sea.
definitions.example_cn: 小船在风暴的海面上颠簸不已。

definitions.explanation_en: A light throw or cast of something, especially when done casually or without much force.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指轻柔、随意地投掷或抛出某物的动作。
definitions.example_en: He gave the coin a quick toss to decide who would go first.
definitions.example_cn: 他快速抛了一下硬币，决定谁先开始。

definitions.explanation_en: A random decision made by flipping a coin or similar method.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指通过掷硬币或其他类似方式做出的随机决定。
definitions.example_en: It was a coin toss whether we went to the beach or stayed home.
definitions.example_cn: 我们是去海滩还是待在家里，全靠掷硬币决定。

comparison.analysis: “Throw” (投掷) 是更通用的词，强调施加力量将物体从手中送出，可远可近，力度可大可小。而 “toss” 更强调轻快、随意、无目的性的动作，通常力度较小，常用于非正式语境。
“Fling” (猛掷) 比 “toss” 更具情绪色彩，常带有愤怒、厌恶或强烈情绪，动作更猛烈、更不加控制。而 “toss” 通常是中性或轻松的，不带强烈情感。
“Shake” (摇晃) 指通过上下或左右快速移动使物体震动，通常不涉及物体离开原位。而 “toss” 指物体被抛离手中，发生位移。两者在描述颠簸时，“toss” 更强调被抛掷的动态，而 “shake” 更强调持续的震动。
